page.title: 11MUGDOCK COUNTRY PARK
page.content: The land for this park was donated by {Sir Hugh Fraser}in 1980 to Central Regional Council.People can walk around,fish,have picnics,and see the country side.It is open to the public and noone has to pay to get in.There are two rangers who can take you for tours,guide you on nature trails or talk about the history of the two castles;Mugdock Castle and Craigend Castle There is a loch called Mugdock Loch which has a large variety of water life.Above it stands Mugdock castle dating from the 13th century and ones owned by the{Dukes of {Montrose.}In recent years the old buildings have become unsafe and much repair is needed.A stone mason has been employed so that the castle can be repaired.
